Workouts.title: Workouts
Workouts.confirmDeleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete your workout template.
Workouts.loginRequired: Please log in to view workouts.

Builder.title: Workout Builder
Builder.errorExercises: Please add at least one exercise
Builder.errorLogin: You must be logged in to save workouts
Builder.placeholderDescription: Describe the goal of this workout...

ActiveWorkout.greatJob: Great job! You've crushed another workout.
ActiveWorkout.cancelWorkoutDescription: This will delete your current progress and return you to the dashboard. This action cannot be undone.

Progress.title: Progress & Analytics
Progress.loginRequired: Please log in to view progress.

Landing.verifiedMessage: Your email has been successfully verified. You can now access your dashboard.

track.title: Track Everything
track.description: Log your workouts, sets, reps, and weights with ease. Keep track of your progress over time.

analytics.title: Advanced Analytics
analytics.description: Visualize your gains with detailed charts and graphs. Understand your volume and intensity.

pr.title: Personal Records
pr.description: Automatically track your PRs for every exercise. Celebrate your milestones.

Auth.loginDescription: Enter your email and password to access your account.
Auth.registerDescription: Create a new account to start tracking your workouts.
Auth.checkEmailDescription: We've sent a confirmation link to {email}.
Auth.checkEmailMessage: Please check your inbox and click the confirmation link to activate your account.

errors.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address.
errors.passwordMin: Password must be at least 6 characters.
errors.usernameMin: Username must be at least 3 characters.
errors.emailNotConfirmed: Please confirm your email address before logging in.
errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.

Auth.promoDescription: Join thousands of athletes who are taking their training to the next level with our professional workout tracking tools.

ExerciseDescriptions.benchpress: Lie on a bench and press the weight up.
ExerciseDescriptions.squat: Lower your hips from a standing position and then stand back up.
ExerciseDescriptions.deadlift: Lift a loaded barbell off the ground to the level of the hips.
ExerciseDescriptions.overheadpress: Press the weight from shoulder level to overhead.
ExerciseDescriptions.pullup: Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar.
ExerciseDescriptions.pushup: Push your body up from the floor using your arms.
ExerciseDescriptions.dumbbellrow: Row a dumbbell to your side while bent over.
ExerciseDescriptions.lunge: Step forward with one leg and lower your hips.
ExerciseDescriptions.plank: Hold a push-up position with your weight on your forearms.
ExerciseDescriptions.cycling: Ride a bicycle or stationary bike.
ExerciseDescriptions.burpees: A full body exercise used in strength training and as an aerobic exercise.
ExerciseDescriptions.jumpingjack: A physical jumping exercise performed by jumping to a position with the legs spread wide and the hands going to the overhead position.
ExerciseDescriptions.mountainclimber: A bodyweight exercise that is useful for burning calories, building stamina, and strengthening the core.
ExerciseDescriptions.armcircle: A simple exercise that targets the shoulders and arms.
ExerciseDescriptions.gobletsquat: A squat performed while holding a weight in front of the chest.
ExerciseDescriptions.dumbbellshoulderpress: A shoulder exercise performed by pressing dumbbells overhead.
ExerciseDescriptions.dumbbellbicepscurl: An arm exercise that targets the biceps.
ExerciseDescriptions.sideplank: An exercise that targets the obliques and helps stabilize the core.
ExerciseDescriptions.sideplankright: An exercise that targets the obliques and helps stabilize the core (Right Side).
ExerciseDescriptions.sideplankleft: An exercise that targets the obliques and helps stabilize the core (Left Side).
ExerciseDescriptions.bicyclecrunch: An abdominal exercise that targets the rectus abdominis and obliques.
